intro: Platyzoma dicarpum, commonly known as the two-seeded flat-leaf plant, is a rare species belonging to the family Arecaceae. It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a small, fibrous capsule containing two seeds. Platyzoma dicarpum is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
